instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.
definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.message: Thanks Duke thought that would be my luck

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with kernel panic, would it be <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> ?
threads.message: Uhm not really, these all have bad GPUs. <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> is only on 2010 machines.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with kernel panic, would it be <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> ?
threads.message: How can i tell what year the boards are ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with kernel panic, would it be <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR> ?
threads.message: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is 2010, <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> is 2011. Also you can just look up the serial number.
